abstract: Gary D. Cohn, long considered the heir apparent at Goldman Sachs, is growing restless. | Fresh questions surround the privatization of Royal Bank of Scotland. | A plan in Washington to remake housing does not seem to reflect lessons learned in the financial crisis.
snippet: Gary D. Cohn, long considered the heir apparent at Goldman Sachs, is growing restless. | Fresh questions surround the privatization of Royal Bank of Scotland. | A plan in Washington to remake housing does not seem to reflect lessons learned in the...
lead_paragraph: “Inside Goldman Sachs, Gary D. Cohn is the man who is waiting — and waiting — to be king,” DealBook’s Susanne Craig writes. While Mr. Cohn has long been considered the heir apparent of Lloyd C. Blankfein, the chairman and chief executive of Goldman, there are few signs that Mr. Blankfein is ready to step aside, insiders say.
